Dear %%FirstName%%:

Thank you for inquiring about Nova Southeastern University's online Master of Science in Law. Congratulations on taking an important step toward a more secure, more exciting, and more lucrative career in your chosen field.

Our program is designed for working adults who want to learn more about the law and how it intersects with their profession.  All of your course work will be completed in a sophisticated, but user-friendly, online format. You’ll have the opportunity earn your graduate degree without disrupting your job/family/home life and complete in 2 years.

I’m here to answer your questions and help you through our streamlined application process. I'll help you complete your application and compile the requisite materials. If accepted, you can start your Master's degree soon and graduate 2 years later.

Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu right away so that I can tell you more about the online MS in Law online program opportunities.

You can schedule a time to zoom or talk by clicking here.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director for Graduate Admissions
Shepard Broad College of Law
Nova Southeastern University
Phone: (954) 262-6367
Ed400@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%:

Thank you for your interest in Nova Southeastern University's online Master of Science in Law program. I’m proud of our online Master's degrees and delighted that you're considering furthering your education with us.

As our Assistant Director Elizabeth DiBiase has mentioned, you can complete the degree online in two years. There is no GRE requirement and, once accepted, you can start in our next class. Before you know it, you’ll have earned your graduate degree. Our alumni report high levels of satisfaction with the program, and are using their training to increase their productivity, enjoy their jobs, and advance their careers.  We have some exciting concentrations which will help you personalize your degree to fit your professional needs.

As you complete your program, be sure to look at the optional concentrations so that you can make the most of your courses and your degree.

I look forward to having you join our program, and invite you to contact Elizabeth at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu. She can tell you more about the program and help guide you through the application process for the online MS in Law program. 

Sincerely, 
 
José Roberto (Beto) Juárez, Jr.
Dean and Professor of Law
Nova Southeastern University | Shepard Broad College of Law

Dear %%FirstName%%:

If you haven't yet begun, let's schedule a time to talk through the application process. I will help ensure that you get everything complete as soon as possible so that your file can be reviewed in advance of the next start. Remember: the sooner you begin the sooner you graduate!

We should also talk about financing your graduate education. Your employer may have a tuition benefit program; have you explored this yet? In addition, many of our students are eligible for financial aid. I can tell you about these options and refer you to someone in Nova Southeastern University's Financial Aid office.

Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu right away so that I can help you complete your application for the online MS in Law program.

You can schedule a time to zoom or talk by clicking here.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director- Graduate Admissions
954-262-6367 ed400@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%:

Did you know that you can earn a concentration in Exceptional Education, Education Law Advocacy or Cybersecurity when you earn your MS in Education Law degree? A concentration in one of these specialized areas along with your MS in Education Law will make you a more marketable professional. Learn more about our concentrations here.

I'm available to help you with the application process. The time to act is now so that we can get your application complete and get you started!

Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu right away so that I can help you complete your application for the online MS in Education Law.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
954-262-6367 or 1-800-541-6682 ext.  26367
ed400@nova.edu

A while back you inquired about Nova Southeastern University's innovative online Master’s degree in Law. The timing wasn't quite right then, but I know you were very interested.

Dear %%FirstName%%,

Thank you for your interest in the NSU LL.M.!

At NSU Shepard Broad College of Law in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, we have designed our LL.M. program to maximize value for attorneys who seek to learn new practice areas, improve the value of your services to clients, and increase revenue. Ours is a general LL.M., but we have focus opportunities in many different areas. The Intellectual Property, Cybersecurity, and Technology focus is the one that can be completed entirely online, and the others can be done on campus or as a combination of online and on campus courses. You can find more information about the areas of focus on our website here.

The program is 30 credits, and it can be completed in one year with full time attendance. You can find information about the program and a link to the application here: https://www.law.nova.edu/llm/index.html. Our  next term starts soon. 

Please feel free to contact me by return email or by phone at 954-262-6289 with any questions. I look forward to hearing from you!

Best regards,

Jennifer

Jennifer McIntyre
Director Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
954-262-6079
mcintyre@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%,

Thank you for your interest in the NSU Shepard Broad College of Law LL.M. program. We are delighted that you are considering furthering your legal education with us.

As our Director Jennifer McIntyre has mentioned, you can complete the degree online (for the Intellectual Property, Cybersecurity, and Technology Law focus) or on campus (for all other focus areas) in one to two years.  Our focus areas will help you personalize your degree to fit your professional needs.  You can find information about the program and a link to the application here: https://www.law.nova.edu/llm/index.html.

I invite you to contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu. I can tell you more about the program and help guide you through the application process for the NSU LL.M. program. I look forward to hearing from you!

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director- Graduate Admissions
954-262-6367 / ed400@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%,

The NSU LL.M. program can be completed in as little as one year without disruption to your personal or professional life. Many classes are offered online with weekly live class sessions to connect with your faculty and fellow students. We also offer a comprehensive on-campus program in most every practice area.

Let’s set up a web conference session to talk!  Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director- Graduate Admissions
954-262-6367 or 1-800-541-6682 ext. 26367
ed400@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%,

A while back you inquired about Nova Southeastern University’s LL.M. program. If the timing wasn’t quite right then, perhaps you would like to continue to explore the opportunity to further your legal education.

As you know, the competition among attorneys is greater than ever, and a graduate degree remains a compelling way to move forward. I’d like to revisit your interest in our LL.M. degree, either online or on campus, and help you get started.

I am here to help you take the next step. Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu right away so that I can tell you more about the opportunity to learn new practice areas, improve the value of your services to clients, and increase revenue.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director- Graduate Admissions
954-262-6367 or 1-800-541-6682 ext. 26367
ed400@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%:

Thank you for inquiring about Nova Southeastern University’s Paralegal Certificate. Congratulations on taking an important step toward a more secure, more exciting, and more lucrative career in your chosen field.

Our program can be completed in one year. All of your course work will be completed online using our state of the art software, although you have the option of taking classes on campus. This program can be completed without disruption to your work and family obligations. The Paralegal Certificate program is a part of the Shepard Broad College of Law and offers highly trained professors to assist you.

I’m here to answer your questions and help you through our streamlined application process. I will help you complete your application and compile the requisite materials.

Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu right away so that I can tell you more about the Paralegal Certificate program at the Shepard Broad College of Law.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director II for Graduate Admissions
Shepard Broad College of Law
Nova Southeastern University
Phone: (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu

Dear %%FirstName%%:

Thank you for your interest in Nova Southeastern University’s Paralegal Certificate. I am proud of our Paralegal Certificate and delighted that you are considering furthering your education with us.

You can complete the certificate in one year. There is no GRE requirement and, once accepted, you can start in our next class. Before you know it, you will have earned your Paralegal Certificate. Our alumni report high levels of satisfaction with the certificate, and are using their certificate to advance their careers.

I look forward to having you join our program, and invite you to contact Elizabeth at 954-262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu. She can tell you more about the program and help guide you through the application process.

Sincerely,



Jessica Garcia-Brown

Dear %%FirstName%%:

In the past, you expressed interest in Nova Southeastern University’s Paralegal Certificate program. I understand how fitting a graduate certificate into your busy life can seem overwhelming, but now is the perfect time to revisit the goal of earning your Paralegal Certificate and having a more secure, more exciting, and more lucrative career in your chosen field.

Our program is designed for busy professionals who have real life obligations and can be completed in one year. All of your course work will be completed online with highly skilled professors.

The timing was not quite right before, but this is the perfect time to begin your program. Please contact me at (954) 262-6367 or ed400@nova.edu right away so that I can tell you more about the Paralegal Certificate offered through the Shepard Broad College of Law.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
Assistant Director II for Graduate Admissions
Shepard Broad College of Law
Nova Southeastern University
Phone: (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu

Did you know you can earn your Master of Science in Law degree online in 1 year? Nova Southeastern University is now offering a fast-track for those who wish to complete their degree in minimal amount of time.  We have waived GRE and LSAT requirement and the online application is simple and concise. We have four starts each year; January, April, June, September.  There are four prestigious programs to choose from.
  • Master of Science in Education Law
  • Master of Science in Employment Law
  • Master of Science in Health Law
  • Master of Science in Law & Policy
Our program will facilitate a comprehensive understanding of the framework and function of the American legal system.  You will learn to identify legal issues in your workplace setting, making you a valuable resource in your industry.  You will distinguish yourself as a leader with specialized regulatory knowledge regarding laws, regulations, and policies relevant to your profession. The sooner you get started, the sooner you will finish!

You can schedule a time to zoom or talk by clicking here.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth DiBiase
954-262-6367 or 1-800-541-6682 ext.  26367
ed400@nova.edu

Did you know you can earn your Master of Science in Law degree online in 1 year? Nova Southeastern University is now offering a fast-track for those who wish to complete their degree in minimal amount of time.  We have waived GRE and LSAT requirement and the online application is simple and concise. We have four starts each year; January, April, June, September.  There are four prestigious programs that are offered: 
  • Master of Science in Education Law
  • Master of Science in Employment Law
  • Master of Science in Health Law
  • Master of Science in Law & Policy
Our program will facilitate a comprehensive understanding of the framework and function of the American legal system.  You will learn to identify legal issues in your workplace setting, making you a valuable resource in your industry.  You will distinguish yourself as a leader with specialized regulatory knowledge regarding laws, regulations, and policies relevant to your profession.

Let me help you get started with a $50 waiver code for the application. Financial aid may also be available.  The sooner you start, the sooner you finish!  I look forward to helping you reach your goals!

Best,


Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | www.law.nova.edu/online

", "availableViews": [], "blocks": { "3b8urewlwvy": { "assetType": { "id": 195, "name": "freeformblock" }, "content": "

Happy New Year!  What is your New Year’s resolution going to be?  Why not pursue that Master’s degree you have been eyeing?  A Master of Science in Law from Nova Southeastern University would look good on your resume!  I know you want this year to be different (way different from 2020) so why not at least start the conversation?  Let us set up a time this week to chat about your future and how I can help you reach your academic goals.  You were interested enough to fill out the inquiry form, so let me tell you all about.  Call or email me per below and start the new year off with some initiative to bring out the best in yourself. Check out the web site and see for yourself.  www.law.nova.edu/online

Talk to you soon!


Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | www.law.nova.edu/online

Hi again!  Did you know that the Master of Science in Law from Nova Southeastern University is fully accredited and has been established for 18 years?  Our renowned online program allows you to complete your schoolwork around your busy schedule.  We have waived the GRE and LSAT test requirement so that is one less hurdle to jump through.  We have 4 starts each year and offer numerous concentrations for each program. Check them out here https://www.law.nova.edu/online/concentrations.html.
Now what are you waiting for? Contact me right now so we can talk more about it and I can answer any questions you may have.  This would make an amazing New Year’s Resolution!

Best,

Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | www.law.nova.edu/online

", "availableViews": [], "blocks": { "x9izqqhwbw": { "assetType": { "id": 195, "name": "freeformblock" }, "content": "

How has your first week of 2021 been?  I can make it even better by offering a $50 application fee waiver when you are ready to apply!  The Master of Science in Law online programs at Nova Southeastern University may be just what you need to get ahead, make yourself more marketable, and enhance your resume.  With personalized academic advising we can customize your course load based on your timeframe and goals.  We offer a Fast-Track option to complete your degree in 1 year, the traditional option completion in 2 years, and a part time option to finish in 4 years.  We want you to succeed, whatever that may look like for you.
Take a look at the website www.law.nova.edu/online and let me know which program you are interested in. Call or email me today so we can talk more about which program duration fits your life best.  I will give you the $50 waiver code so you can complete your application and get started right away.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | www.law.nova.edu/online

Greetings!  It is 2021 and you are looking to make this year one where you finally do something for yourself.  You deserve it!  YOU oversee your future and your academic and professional achievements.  NSU MS programs may be the perfect fit!
Nova Southeastern University Master of Science in Law has 4 online programs to choose from:
  • Master of Science in Education Law
  • Master of Science in Employment Law
  • Master of Science in Health Law
  • Master of Science in Law & Policy
You may qualify for financial aid in addition to outside scholarships.  Please contact me and let me guide you to reaching your goals and resolutions.  Start looking at the website https://www.law.nova.edu/online/index.html.  Let us talk about what NSU can offer you!

Talk to you soon!

Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law

Did you know you can earn your Master of Science in Law degree online in 1 year? Nova Southeastern University is now offering a fast-track for those who wish to complete their degree in minimal amount of time.  We have waived GRE and LSAT requirement and the online application is simple and concise. We have four starts each year; January, April, June, September.  There are four prestigious programs to choose from. Winter start is January 3, 2022.
 
  • Master of Science in Education Law
  • Master of Science in Employment Law
  • Master of Science in Health Law
  • Master of Science in Law & Policy
Our program will facilitate a comprehensive understanding of the framework and function of the American legal system.  You will learn to identify legal issues in your workplace setting, making you a valuable resource in your industry.  You will distinguish yourself as a leader with specialized regulatory knowledge regarding laws, regulations, and policies relevant to your profession. The sooner you get started, the sooner you will finish!

Check out the website for more info and contact me! https://law.nova.edu/online/


Sincerely,

 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
 
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
 
Shepard Broad College of Law
 
Office (954) 262-6367
 
ed400@nova.edu | www.law.nova.edu/online

Schedule a time to speak

", "availableViews": [], "blocks": { "m6q80k5jom": { "assetType": { "id": 195, "name": "freeformblock" }, "content": "
Did you know you can earn your Master of Science in Law degree online in 1 year? Nova Southeastern University is now offering a fast-track for those who wish to complete their degree in minimal amount of time.  We have waived GRE and LSAT requirement and the online application is simple and concise. We have four starts each year; January, April, June, September.  There are four prestigious programs that are offered:
 
  • Master of Science in Education Law
  • Master of Science in Employment Law
  • Master of Science in Health Law
  • Master of Science in Law & Policy

Our program will facilitate a comprehensive understanding of the framework and function of the American legal system.  You will learn to identify legal issues in your workplace setting, making you a valuable resource in your industry.  You will distinguish yourself as a leader with specialized regulatory knowledge regarding laws, regulations, and policies relevant to your profession.

Let me help you get started with a $50 waiver code for the application. Financial aid may also be available.  The sooner you start, the sooner you finish!  I look forward to helping you reach your goals!

Best,

 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | nova.edu
Schedule a time to speak

Your employer may offer tuition reimbursement as part of your employee benefits.  Your Master of Science in Law degree could be financially attainable with the help of your employer. Check with your Humans Resources department today!
 
The Nova Southeastern University Master of Science in Law programs is designed for working professionals.  All programs are offered entirely online and typically takes two years to complete but can be completed in 1 year fast track. We do not require GRE or LSAT testing. NSU also offers financial aid for those who qualify.
 


I’m happy to meet via zoom or phone call; please click on the link to schedule an appointment. Schedule a time to speak
 
There are 4 programs to choose from:
Education Law
Employment Law
Health Law
Law & Policy
 
Upcoming semesters for 2022:
Spring April 4
Summer June 27
Fall September 26
 
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law

Did you know that the College of Law has graduate programs for those who do not want to be a lawyer or go to ‘law school’ but do want to learn more about the law and how it intersects with different professions?  All programs can be completed as quickly as ONE YEAR with multiple start dates: June, September, January, and April.  Come visit the Leo Goodwin Shepard College of Law building and join me for an information session on the following programs:
  • Master of Science Education Law
  • Master of Science Employment Law
  • Master of Science Health Law
  • Master of Science Law & Policy
  • Graduate Paralegal Certificate

Date – Tuesday April 5th
Time – 12noon-1pm
Location – Leo Goodwin Sr. Building 
                Shepard Broad College of Law
                Lecture Room 3 (behind the Supreme Court Café)
                
If you can’t attend please feel free to contact me for a personal meeting or schedule a time here.
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | nova.edu
Schedule a time to speak

Now is the time to get the NSU EDGE and add value to your career!

The Master of Science in Law Programs are designed for professionals to complete their course work entirely online and you can finish the program in 2 years or less.  We do not require a GRE or LSAT to apply and you may qualify for Financial Aid!  Your may also have employer reimbursement.
  
There are 4 programs to choose from:
Education Law
Employment Law
Health Law
Law & Policy
Learn about our FAST TRACK to complete the degree in 1 year!

Attend the information session and learn all about program details and I will give you a $50 waiver code for the application!
  
Upcoming semesters for 2022:
Summer June 27
Fall September 26

Click HERE to register for an Information Session:
When: May 11, 2022 04:00 PM Eastern Time 

Can’t attend the session but still interested?  Schedule a meeting directly with me by clicking here  Schedule a time to speak

Please contact me with any questions.
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | https://www.law.nova.edu/online

Thank you again for your interest Nova Southeastern University’s Shepard Broad College of Law.  It is not too late to begin your new academic journey this Summer 2022 term.
The programs are completely online and do not require an LSAT or GRE. Do not delay this great opportunity to learn more about how you can earn a Master of Science at NSU in as little as two years and begin June 27 for our summer 2022 term.

Information about our graduate programs and admission requirements can be found at https://law.nova.edu/.
 
You can finish your application by visiting https://apply.nova.edu/.
 
Have your official transcripts from every college/university attended sent to Nova Southeastern University. If they will send it electronically, the address is electronictranscript@nova.edu, otherwise the postal address is Nova Southeastern University, Enrollment Processing Services, 3301 College Avenue, P.O. Box 299000, Ft. Lauderdale, FL  33314.
 
If using financial aid, you will need to do the 22-23 application for the Summer 2022 and Fall 2022. Visit https://studentaid.gov.
 
Call me for assistance with your enrollment needs. Have a nice day and talk to you soon.
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | https://law.nova.edu/online/
SCHEDULE A TIME TO SPEAK

You could be starting your degree next month!  Our application process is simple and acceptance decisions are made weekly. Don’t delay your academic goals.

Now is the time to get the NSU EDGE and add value to your career!

The Master of Science in Law Programs are designed for professionals to complete their course work entirely online and you can finish the program in 2 years or less. We do not require a GRE or LSAT to apply and you may qualify for Financial Aid!  Your may also have employer reimbursement.
  
There are 4 programs to choose from:
Education Law
Employment Law
Health Law
Law & Policy
Learn about our FAST TRACK to complete the degree in 1 year!

Attend the information session and learn all about program details and I will give you a $50 waiver code for the application!
  
Upcoming semesters:
Fall September 26, 2022
Winter January 2, 2023
Spring April 3, 2023

You are invited to a Zoom meeting.
When: Aug 12, 2022 10:00 AM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

Register in advance for this meeting:
https://nova.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJYqfu6rqzgiE9P7Zhb0uxWWa4eVJMwCmWj3 

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Can’t attend the session but still interested?  Schedule a meeting directly with me by clicking here Schedule a time to speak 

Please contact me with any questions.

 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | https://www.law.nova.edu/online
Schedule a time to speak




Apply Now!

The holiday season is quickly approaching.  Don’t forget to do something nice for yourself, like start that Master of Science in Law program you were thinking about. Amid the hustle and bustle please find time to schedule a 15-minute conversation with me so I can share with you how this degree is possible for you!  Our programs are completely online with no GRE or LSAT required.  The application process is simple, and you could start as early as January or April.  Please click the link below and schedule a meeting via phone.  I look forward to speaking with you.
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law

It’s almost that time of the year where you bestow hearts, candy, and flowers to that special someone. Don’t forget to do something nice for yourself, like start that Master of Science in Law program you were thinking about. You can find time to schedule a 15-minute conversation with me so I can share with you how this degree is possible for you! Our programs are completely online with no GRE or LSAT required. The application process is simple, and you could start as early as April or June.  

My Valentine gift to you is waiving the $50 application fee if you apply to start the program in 2023!

Please click the link below and schedule a meeting via phone or zoom.  I look forward to speaking with you.
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | https://law.nova.edu/online/

You can be a Shark in the Master of Science in Law online program.  I can help get you on your way with a $50 application waiver.

The MS Law programs are just what you need to learn how the laws intersect with your career, make yourself more marketable, and move up within your industry. Classes are taught from distinguished law professors and are designed for working professionals. Our programs are completely online with no GRE or LSAT required and can be completed in 1-2 years!  The application process is simple, and you could start as early as June.  

To schedule a 15-minute conversation with me so I can share with you how this degree is possible for you, click the link below and select a meeting via phone or zoom.  I look forward to speaking with you.

Click the link below to register for one of the information sessions.
Tuesday May 23, 2023 11:00 AM Eastern Time (US and Canada)
Thursday May 25, 2023 01:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
Assistant Director II Graduate and Online Programs
Shepard Broad College of Law
Office (954) 262-6367
ed400@nova.edu | https://law.nova.edu/online/

Dear Potential MS in Law Student:

From Fall 2018 to Spring 2023, I had the opportunity to complete an MS in Employment Law with an emphasis in Human Resource Management Law.  My time with the program was rewarding in multiple ways:  the option of class work was impeccable; instructors were informative, constantly engaged, and all encouraged students to learn and participate.  Lesson plans were laid out well, which gave a strong foundation for students at various levels – newly exposed to employment law issues, up to individuals such as myself, who have been in Human Resource Management a number of years.

Others involved with the educational process included law school library and administrative personnel, all of whom were knowledgeable in their departments, assisting in any way possible.

If you are considering an MS in employment law, I strongly encourage you to consider the Shepard Broad College of Law at NOVA Southeastern University.  It is a seamless program, where you will walk away as a better educated employment law professional!

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Thank you!

Sincerely,

Tedi J Roach, MS, SPHR, SHRM-SCP
HRM Consultant
Blue Heron HR Consulting, LLC
blueheron.hr.consult@gmail.com

Welcome Prospective Students!

If you are interested in a preeminent Master of Science in Law program, then look no further than the Shepard Broad College of Law M.S. program. I would like to congratulate you on taking the important first step in advancing your education.
 
As an Alumnae of the Shepard Broad College of Law, it is an honor and privilege to teach in this exceptional program at NSU. My students are engaged professionals who are seeking to elevate themselves both professionally and personally. I enjoy teaching students and giving a variety of opportunities to study the principles of dispute resolution, employment law and the core legal foundations. Students are engrossed in the material in both synchronous and asynchronous learning, which provides a level of flexibility.
 
The M.S. program at NSU Law will broaden your horizons as we explore the law and how it is intertwined with the employment sector, healthcare profession and businesses every day. My students gain practical skills they can use, like our practicum Negotiation Exercise. Students participate in a mock negotiation and use the elements they learn about in Alternative Dispute Resolution.
 
 If you decide to join our program and the NSU Law family, I am sure it will be a transformative experience academically and professionally! Wishing you the best in your academic career and hope to “see” you in class!
 
Tiffany D. Garner, M.S., J.D.
“Professor G”

", "availableViews": [], "blocks": { "1okem98kfue": { "assetType": { "id": 195, "name": "freeformblock" }, "content": "
As you are enjoying pumpkin spice everything, pause to consider enhancing your career in the new year.  The holidays are coming and soon will be new year’s resolutions. Plan now to begin the Master of Science in Law program at NSU beginning January 2024.

The MS Law programs are just what you need to learn how the laws intersect with your career, make yourself more marketable, and move up within your industry. Classes are taught from distinguished law professors and are designed for working professionals. Our programs are completely online with no GRE or LSAT required.

Sign up for one of the fall information sessions.  If you decide to apply for the 2024 start dates, I will waive your $50 application fee.  Click on a date below to sign up.
 
  • Thursday October 5th 12pm
  • Wednesday October 18th 2pm
  • Wednesday November 1st 11am
  • Tuesday November 14th 12pm
  • Tuesday December 5th 12pm

I look forward to helping you reach your professional goals.
 
Elizabeth DiBiase, MS
 
Associate Director, Graduate and Online Programs 
Shepard Broad College of Law 
Office (954) 262-6367 
ed400@nova.edu | https://law.nova.edu/online/
